Synthesis Method: Induction furnace melting at 1300 °C under argon, cast in a rectangular copper mold.
Key Findings: Shows 1.68 wt% H₂ capacity at 25 °C, reversible absorption, good kinetics, operates 0–50 °C and 1–40 bar.; Elastic modulus of Ti0.5Fe0.45Mn0.05 varies with measurement scale (ultrasonic, compression, nanoindentation).; Mean elastic modulus 198 GPa; varied 186–215 GPa with compression.; Mean indentation elastic modulus 294 ± 60 GPa; domain moduli 265–384 GPa and hardness 9.2–25.4 GPa.
Comments: TiFe-based alloy with 5 % Mn substitution reduces defects and improves diffusivity.; Cylindrical samples 10 mm × 15 mm; internally cracked specimens excluded.; Alloy shows strong microscale heterogeneity in modulus and hardness.; Heterogeneous microstructure; Ti-rich domains up to 85 at% Ti.; Mn content and precipitates cause wide elastic range.
